# High-level goals
- This project is a spring boot microservice for authentication (JWT, email verification, password reset)
- Use clean, idiomatic Java 17
- Follow hexagonal architecture principles when possible

# Coding style preferences
- Write text in English.
- Use meaningful names for variables, methods, and classes.
- Follow standard Java naming conventions (camelCase for variables and methods, PascalCase for classes).
- Use Lombok to reduce boilerplate code.
- Prefer immutability where possible.
- Prefer constructor injection over field injection.
- Use Optional instead of returning null.
- Never expose entities directly - use DTOs.
- Write methods with clear, single responsibility.
- Organize unit tests ino Arrange-act-assert structure.


# Formatting preferences
- Use two-line spacing between class members.
- Limit methods to 30 lines when possible.

# Documentation rules
- Add JavaDoc to public methods and classes.
